definition: Modesty leads to progress, arrogance makes you drop behind (favorite slogan of Mao Zedong)
pinyin: xu1 xin1 shi3 ren2 jin4 bu4 , jiao1 ao4 shi3 ren2 luo4 hou4
containing_words.word: 虛心使人進步，驕傲使人落後

sentences.english: The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the wayside; they have set gins for me.
sentences.chinese: 驕傲人爲我暗設網羅和繩索。

sentences.english: I am very proud of Aidan, we all are.
sentences.chinese: 我爲艾登感到驕傲，我們都這樣認爲。
他驕傲地誇示他的畢業文憑。

sentences.english: His mother railed at him for his haughtiness.
sentences.chinese: 他的母親由於他的驕傲自大而責備他。

sentences.english: James proudly sports his new watch.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯驕傲地誇示他的新表。

sentences.english: My song has put off her adornments . She has no pride of dress and decoration.
sentences.chinese: 我的詩歌卸掉妝飾，她沒有衣飾的驕傲。

sentences.english: In this experience, I no longer proud, learn.
sentences.chinese: 在這次經歷後，我不再驕傲，虛心學習。

sentences.english: This is the most precious treasure of which Dragon & Lion takes the utmost pride.
sentences.chinese: 這是龍獅最爲自豪和值得驕傲的寶貴財富。

sentences.english: I am very proud of Lily's capacity .
sentences.chinese: 我真爲莉莉的肚量感到驕傲。

sentences.english: I think the cup of 34E is absolutely niubable, you should be proud of.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲34E罩杯是很值得牛逼的，你應該感到驕傲。

sentences.english: Keep him in that state of mind as long as you can.
sentences.chinese: 儘量讓他保持驕傲，論斷，不悔改的狀態，越久越好。

sentences.english: Having others pay your cheak is worth showing off, paying your own is worth proud of.
sentences.chinese: 男人付帳值得炫耀，但自己埋單那叫驕傲。

sentences.english: The international team of engineers have real pride in their work.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的國際工程師們對這一偉大工程感到非常驕傲。

sentences.english: Most makes me arrogantly is, I will have one pair to become the future dulcimer hand.
sentences.chinese: 最令我驕傲的是，我有一雙成爲未來揚琴家的手。

sentences.english: I know I would be if my son were valedictorian.
sentences.chinese: 如果我兒子是發言人，我就會很驕傲。

definition: happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
huge/great/grand/worthy of the greatest admiration/important (contribution etc)
to feel happy/to rejoice/to have a great time/to make fun of sb
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
